module.p: Calum Malcolm is a masculine anthroponymic proper noun.

section.p:
The principal parts of Calum are –
Calum – nominative/dative (singular)
Chaluim – genitive (singular)
A Chaluim! – vocative
Like all proper nouns, Calum can be modified by an attributive adjective.

Some examples –
Tha Calum mór agus Màiri bheag ag obair gu trang anns an achadh an diugh.
Big Malcolm and little Mary are working busily in the field today. td. 9

Examples with bi be –
Tha Calum mór.
Malcolm is big. td. 6
Tha Calum ag obair.
Malcolm is working. td. 6

In a conjoined subject with agus and –
Tha Màiri agus Calum trang an diugh – tha iad ag obair anns an achadh.
Mary and Malcolm are busy today – they are working in the field. td. 7
Tha Calum mór agus Màiri bheag ag obair gu trang anns an achadh an diugh.
Big Malcolm and little Mary are working busily in the field today. td. 9
Calum can be used as the complement of a preposition.

Some examples –
Tha falt dubh air Calum ach tha falt bàn air Màiri.
Calum has black hair but Mary has fair hair. td. 9
